company.name: Rimas Music
company.description: Multi-regional music company with complex financial operations requiring automated journal entry synchronization between QuickBooks and regional accounting systems (Sage 50 Spain, CONTPAQi Mexico).

status.nextAction: Eugenio site visit - identify blockers and build momentum
status.currentPhase: Post-demo technical validation, awaiting European stakeholder feedback

overview.useCase: Automated journal entry synchronization between QuickBooks and Sage 50 Spain
overview.value: $35-40K+ multi-year engagement with Mexico expansion potential
overview.pain: Manual financial data entry between systems, multi-regional compliance requirements, shared Sage access limitations
overview.solution: Make.com automation with on-premise agent for Sage 50 Spain integration
businessDrivers: Support business expansion into new markets

primary.name: Gustavo Rivera
primary.notes: Decision maker, price-accepting, requires boss-level validation, Spanish speaker

technical.name: Johan Vazquez-Alicea
technical.notes: Primary technical validator, engaged in architecture discussions

technical.name: Carlos
technical.notes: QuickBooks expert, described as 'better equipped than both you and I', key for data mapping

technical.name: Allan
technical.notes: Has current Sage 50 access, shares credentials with Europe contact

technical.name: Europe Contact
technical.notes: Missing stakeholder - primary user not validated, limited availability due to timezone

technical.name: AMMartin
technical.notes: Documented team member, role TBD, not active in calls

makeTeam.name: David Ponce
makeTeam.notes: Primary relationship owner, handling proposals and pricing

makeTeam.name: Jonathan Smeltser
makeTeam.notes: Technical demo leader, architecture validator, Mexico research

makeTeam.name: Ed Axe
makeTeam.notes: Top Make.com partner, 3 years experience, São Paulo based, handles custom development

architecture.description: On-premise to cloud integration requiring custom SDK development
architecture.dataFlow: QuickBooks (Cloud) → Make.com Cloud → HTTP Agent → On-Prem Agent → Custom API Layer → Sage 50 Spain (Desktop)
components: QuickBooks journal entry search and export
HTTP Agent Module for on-premise connectivity

systems.name: QuickBooks
systems.details: Source system for all journal entries, no supporting documents transfer needed

systems.name: Sage 50 Spain
systems.details: Target system, single-user desktop app, requires SDK development (~€1,500)

systems.name: CONTPAQi
systems.details: Phase 2 expansion, AR Software API solution available (open source)

challenges: No native API for Sage 50 Spain - requires custom SDK development with Visual Studio
On-premise desktop application with single-user access limitations
Regional software differences - Spain version differs from UK/US Sage 50
COM object programming complexity and version compatibility issues
Shared Sage credentials between Allan and Europe contact creates access conflicts
Infrastructure issues in Spain office (recent power outages mentioned)
requirements: Make.com on-premise agent with custom API layer development
Windows service using Sage 50 Spain SDK (~€1,500 license required)
Visual Studio with Sage50 SDK plugin from marketplace
.NET Framework 4.7.2+ for COM interop and CRUD operations
ODBC for data validation and duplicate checking
Encrypted data transmission within network security requirements
Host computer installation where Sage 50 is running

developmentApproach.preferredTechnology: Visual Studio 2017/2019/2022 with Sage50 SDK plugin
developmentApproach.programmingModel: C# for COM interop, ODBC for reads, COM objects for writes
developmentApproach.apiPattern: REST endpoints via Windows service for Make.com HTTP Agent
developmentApproach.dataFormat: JSON to XML conversion for Sage 50 Spain format
developmentApproach.securityModel: API key authentication, localhost-only API, encrypted transmission

milestones.details: Architecture validation, confirmed on-premise requirements, Jonathan brought in
Live demo with Sage Intacct proxy, Ed Axe introduction, Mexico expansion discovered
Full technical analysis and implementation approach documented
30min virtual + 30min Spanish in-person sessions to identify blockers

risks.description: Missing European stakeholder engagement - primary Sage 50 user not validated
risks.mitigation: Direct engagement during site visit, video review follow-up, Spanish-language trust building

risks.description: Custom SDK development complexity and timeline risk
risks.mitigation: Present cloud migration alternative with faster time-to-value, detailed technical validation

risks.description: Senior management approval required beyond team acceptance
risks.mitigation: Provide proof-of-concept materials, boss-level validation approach

risks.description: Shared Sage access creating installation conflicts
risks.mitigation: Clarify installation process, remote deployment approach

risks.description: Infrastructure challenges - power outages in Spain office
risks.mitigation: Cloud-first approach discussion, backup power recommendations

currentProposal.operationsExample: 100 journal entries/day = 102 operations (1 search + 1 transform + 100 posts)

expansionOpportunity.note: Mexico integration simpler using AR Software's open source CONTPAQi API

businessFactors: Successful technical demo completed with live journal entry transfer
Team shows technical understanding and engagement
technicalValidation: On-premise architecture requirements confirmed by both teams
AR Software solution identified for Mexico Phase 2
relationshipDynamics: Strong rapport with Gustavo and Johan
Carlos identified as QuickBooks expert and key validator
Missing European stakeholder creates decision gap

notes.author: David Ponce & Jonathan Smeltser
notes.content: Architecture validation call. Confirmed Sage 50 desktop-only nature, brought Jonathan for technical validation, identified need for on-premise connector.

notes.author: Technical Team (David, Jonathan, Ed)
notes.content: Full technical demo with Gustavo, Carlos, Allan. Live journal entry transfer demo using Sage Intacct proxy. Ed Axe introduced as implementation partner. Mexico CONTPAQi opportunity discovered. Price acceptance confirmed. Europe contact absent - needs video review.

notes.author: Eugenio Handover Team
notes.content: Complete documentation package created. Technical landscape mapped, SDK requirements detailed, transcript analyses completed. Ready for site visit to identify blockers and build momentum.
notes.status: Deal stalling post-demo, Spanish session critical for trust building

callToAction.immediateNext: Eugenio site visit to identify what's preventing forward movement
criticalQuestions: What specific concerns emerged from European stakeholder video review?
Are they evaluating cloud migration vs. custom development options?
What's their comfort level with Ed Axe implementation partnership?
Timeline and budget expectations for €1,500 SDK development?
Interest level in Mexico expansion opportunity?
